At Wed, 30 Jan 2008 10:54:34 +0000 (GMT),
lakshmi munagala <laxmi_mlr@...> wrote:
>
> HI Erik,
>
> Very glad to see your reply.Thank you very much.Now i installed
> HERITRIX-1.12.1(heritrix-1.12.1.zip) on my windows machine without
> source files to try this out. when i add ContentTypeRegexpDecideRule
> after write processors it is asking for regexp,so i gave
> "[^a-zA-Z0-9]+" and "REJECT".Even then it is downloading pages from
> japanese site.I tried giving "Accept-Language:en" as header,even
> that didnot work.By the way,I did not understand the special
> characters mentioned in your mail.Can u please explain in detail.

Sorry, I was unclear in my message. The short answer is, you cannot
filter by language.

The longer answer is, you could write a *new* deciding scope rule
based on ContentTypeMatchesRegExpDecideRule which filters on the
Content-Language HTTP header (see section 14.12 of
<http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt>. But this HTTP header is little
used. You absolutely cannot rely on English-language websites
identifying themselves using the HTTP header Content-Language: en. You
might be able to filter out sites which use the Content-Language
header to identify themselves as being *not* English-language sites.
But this will not be very effective.

By the way, the special characters were unicode quote marks. I have
avoided them in this message.

best,
Erik Hetzner
